snippet: Israel expanded its four-day assault on Gaza on Saturday to the civilian political infrastructure, leveling the headquarters of the Hamas prime minister and striking police and security buildings.
abstract: Israel broadens its assault on Gaza Strip from mostly military targets to centers of government infrastructure; obliterates headquarters of Hamas Prime Min Ismail Haniya with barrage of five bombs; conflict shows no signs of abating as fighting ends its fourth day.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Gaza City, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Reporting was contributed by Fares Akram and Tyler Hicks from the Gaza Strip, Carol Sutherland and Iritz Pazner Garshowitz from Jerusalem, and David D. Kirkpatrick and Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Israel expanded its four-day assault on Gaza on Saturday to the civilian political infrastructure, leveling the headquarters of the Hamas prime minister and striking police and security buildings.

headline.seo: Israel Steps Up Aerial Strikes in Gaza
headline.main: Israel Broadens Its Bombing in Gaza to Include Government Sites
headline.print_headline:
Israel Widens Gaza Assault,
Hitting Government Targets
